LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Edge_network.update_router.js

// Required dependencies
const {EdgeNetworkServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/edgenetwork');
const client = new EdgeNetworkServiceClient();

// Update the router
async function updateRouter(id, updateParams) {
  const request = {router: id, update: updateParams};
  const [operation] = await client.updateRouter(request);
  console.log('Router updated:', operation);
}

updateRouter('your-router-id', {name: 'updated-router-name'});
```

TITLE: Creating Taxonomy in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a taxonomy in Google Cloud's Data Catalog service using the Node.js client library. It requires the google-cloud-datacatalog package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

async function createTaxonomy() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION',
    taxonomy: {
      displayName: 'YOUR_TAXONOMY_NAME',
      description: 'Your taxonomy description',
    },
  };
  const [response] = await client.createTaxonomy(request);
  console.log(`Taxonomy created: ${response.name}`);
}
createTaxonomy();
```

TITLE: Querying Places using Text Search with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example of using the Places API client library to perform a text search. This snippet demonstrates how to instantiate the client, construct a request with a text query, and handle the response including specifying field masks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-maps-places/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Places library
const {PlacesClient} = require('@googlemaps/places').v1;

// Instantiates a client
const placesClient = new PlacesClient();

async function callSearchText() {
  // Construct request
  const request = {
    textQuery,
  };

  // Run request
  const response = await placesClient.searchText(request, {
    otherArgs: {
      headers: {
        'X-Goog-FieldMask': 'places.displayName',
      },
    },
  });
  console.log(response);
}

callSearchText();
```

TITLE: Deleting Subscription - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to delete a subscription to a data exchange using the Analytics Hub API in Node.js. Authentication is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-bigquery-analyticshub/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Sample code to delete a subscription
// Requires installation of the Google Cloud client library

const {AnalyticsHubServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/bigquery-analyticshub');
const client = new AnalyticsHubServiceClient();

async function deleteSubscription() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/your-project-id/subscriptions/your-subscription-id',
  };
  const [response] = await client.deleteSubscription(request);
  console.log('Subscription deleted:', response);
}

deleteSubscription();
```

TITLE: Analyzing Entities with Google Cloud Language API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to analyze entities in text using the Google Cloud Language API. It requires the 'google-cloud-language' package as a dependency. The input is the text to analyze, and the output is a list of recognized entities along with their types and salience scores.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-language/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Load the Google Cloud client library
const language = require('@google-cloud/language');

// Creates a client
const client = new language.LanguageServiceClient();

async function analyzeEntities(text) {
  const document = {
    content: text,
    type: 'PLAIN_TEXT',
  };

  const [result] = await client.analyzeEntities({document});
  const entities = result.entities;
  console.log('Entities:');
  entities.forEach(entity => {
    console.log(`	Name: ${entity.name}, Type: ${entity.type}, Salience: ${entity.salience}`);
  });
}
```

TITLE: Creating NFS Share - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create an NFS share in Google Cloud's Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. It requires the Google Cloud client libraries and proper authentication setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function createNfsShare() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION',
    nfsShareId: 'YOUR_NFS_SHARE_ID',
    nfsShare: {
      // NFS share configuration here
    },
  };
  const [operation] = await client.createNfsShare(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log('NFS Share created:', response);
}
createNfsShare();
```

TITLE: Creating a Model in AutoML with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to create a model in AutoML using Node.js. It demonstrates the process of configuring and initiating the model creation, with necessary parameters and expected outcomes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-automl/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const automl = require('@google-cloud/automl');

// Instantiate client
const client = new automl.v1.AutoMlClient();

async function createModel(projectId, computeRegion, datasetId, modelName) {
  const model = {
    displayName: modelName,
    datasetId: datasetId,
    textClassification: {
      annotationSpecId: 'your-annotation-spec-id',
    },
  };
  const request = {
    parent: client.locationPath(projectId, computeRegion),
    model: model,
  };
  const [operation] = await client.createModel(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log(`Model created: ${response.name}`);
}

createModel('your-project-id', 'us-central1', 'your-dataset-id', 'My Model');
```

TITLE: Getting Provisioning Config - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to retrieve the provisioning configuration details in the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. Ensure you have the necessary permissions set for your API request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_17

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function getProvisioningConfig() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/provisioningConfigs/YOUR_PROVISIONING_CONFIG_ID',
  };
  const response = await client.getProvisioningConfig(request);
  console.log('Provisioning Config details:', response);
}
getProvisioningConfig();
```

TITLE: Translating Text using Google Cloud Translation API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: A quickstart example showing how to use the Google Cloud Translation API to translate text from English to Russian. It demonstrates client instantiation, translation request, and handling the translation response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-translate/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
/**
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment the following line before running the sample.
 */
// const projectId = 'YOUR_PROJECT_ID';

// Imports the Google Cloud client library
const {Translate} = require('@google-cloud/translate').v2;

// Instantiates a client
const translate = new Translate({projectId});

async function quickStart() {
  // The text to translate
  const text = 'Hello, world!';

  // The target language
  const target = 'ru';

  // Translates some text into Russian
  const [translation] = await translate.translate(text, target);
  console.log(`Text: ${text}`);
  console.log(`Translation: ${translation}`);
}

quickStart();
```

## [0.4.1](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/compare/connectors-v0.4.0...connectors-v0.4.1) (2025-03-19)


### Bug Fixes

* [Many APIs] await/catch promises, and update listOperationsAsync return type ([#6184](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/6184)) ([2fcd202](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/2fcd2029c35e8fb2199d03ac6e61e2d821ddf72e))

## [0.4.0](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/compare/connectors-v0.3.0...connectors-v0.4.0) (2025-03-18)


###  BREAKING CHANGES

* upgrade to Node 18 ([#6096](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/6096))

### Features

* [Many APIs] add request/response debug logging to gapics ([e7409c8](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/e7409c87febcf33359a2d36ae4551f502b8a2f93))


### Miscellaneous Chores

* Upgrade to Node 18 ([#6096](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/6096)) ([eadae64](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/eadae64d54e07aa2c65097ea52e65008d4e87436))

## [0.3.0](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/compare/connectors-v0.2.0...connectors-v0.3.0) (2024-05-21)


### Features

* [Many APIs] update Nodejs generator to send API versions in headers for GAPICs ([#5351](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/5351)) ([01f48fc](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/01f48fce63ec4ddf801d59ee2b8c0db9f6fb8372))
* [Many APIs] update Nodejs generator to send API versions in headers for GAPICs ([#5354](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/5354)) ([a9784ed](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/a9784ed3db6ee96d171762308bbbcd57390b6866))

### Features

* [Many APIs] add several fields to manage state of database encryption update ([#5187](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/5187)) ([1952fbe](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/1952fbe432b96115278d42e5c1dbdbc7de39036b))

TITLE: Deleting an Environment - Google Cloud Dataplex - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet deletes an environment from Google Cloud Dataplex, helping to manage project resources efficiently by removing unneeded environments.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-dataplex/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Example code to delete an environment
const {DataplexServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/dataplex');
const client = new DataplexServiceClient();
async function deleteEnvironment() {
  const request = {name: 'name_of_the_environment'};

TITLE: Using Policy Troubleshooter IAM Client Library
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to initialize the Policy Troubleshooter client and make a troubleshoot IAM policy request. The code shows setting up the client, constructing a request with an access tuple, and executing the troubleshoot operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-policytroubleshooter-iam/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Iam library
const {PolicyTroubleshooterClient} =
  require('@google-cloud/policy-troubleshooter-iam').v3beta;

// Instantiates a client
const iamClient = new PolicyTroubleshooterClient();

async function callTroubleshootIamPolicy() {
  const project = await iamClient.getProjectId();
  const accessTuple = {
    principal: 'alice@example.com',
    fullResourceName: `//cloudresourcemanager.googleapis.com/projects/${project}`,
  };

  // Construct request
  const request = {
    accessTuple,
  };

  // Run request
  const response = await iamClient.troubleshootIamPolicy(request);
  console.log(response);
}

callTroubleshootIamPolicy();
```

TITLE: Listing Taxonomies in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet details how to list Taxonomies available within a project and location in Google Cloud Data Catalog using the google-cloud-datacatalog library with Node.js. It makes use of the `listTaxonomies` method. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(parent) {
  // [START datacatalog_list_taxonomies]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const parent = 'projects/{project}/locations/{location}';

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function listTaxonomies() {
    const [taxonomies] = await policyTagManagerClient.listTaxonomies({
      parent: parent,
    });
    console.log('Taxonomies:');
    taxonomies.forEach(taxonomy => console.log(taxonomy));
  }
  listTaxonomies();
  // [END datacatalog_list_taxonomies]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```

TITLE: Listing App Engine Services using Node.js Client
DESCRIPTION: Example shows how to initialize the App Engine Services client and list all services for a specified project. Uses the ServicesClient class from the appengine-admin package to make API calls.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-appengine/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Cloud client library

const {ServicesClient} = require('@google-cloud/appengine-admin');

// TODO(developer): replace with your prefered project ID.
// const projectId = 'my-project'

// Creates a client
const client = new ServicesClient();

async function listVersions() {
  const [versions] = await client.listServices({
    parent: `apps/${projectId}`,
  });
  console.info(versions);
}
listVersions();
```

TITLE: Listing Workflows - Google Cloud Workflows - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists all workflows in a specified Google Cloud project and location. It requires Node.js and access to Google Cloud Workflows API. The project ID and location are key parameters for the request. The output will include details of all workflows in a JSON format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-workflows-executions/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {WorkflowsClient} = require('@google-cloud/workflows-executions');

async function listWorkflows() {
  const client = new WorkflowsClient();
  const request = {parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION_ID'};
  const [response] = await client.listWorkflows(request);
  console.log(response);
}
listWorkflows();
```

const {IDSClient} = require('@google-cloud/ids');

const client = new IDSClient();

async function listEndpoints() {
  const request = {

  };
  const responses = await client.listEndpoints(request);
  for await (const response of responses) {
    console.log(response);
  }
}
listEndpoints();
```

TITLE: Updating Policy Tag in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to update an existing policy tag in Google Cloud's Data Catalog using the Node.js client library. The google-cloud-datacatalog package is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

async function updatePolicyTag() {
  const request = {
    policyTag: {
      name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/policyTags/YOUR_POLICY_TAG_ID',
      displayName: 'UPDATED_POLICY_TAG_NAME',
    },
  };
  const [response] = await client.updatePolicyTag(request);
  console.log(`Policy tag updated: ${response.name}`);
}
updatePolicyTag();
```

TITLE: Moderating Text with Google Cloud Language API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases how to moderate text using Google Cloud's Language API. It utilizes the 'google-cloud-language' Node.js library as a dependency. The function analyzes the text for moderation, returning likelihood of various types of content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-language/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Load the Google Cloud client library
const language = require('@google-cloud/language');

// Creates a client
const client = new language.LanguageServiceClient();

async function moderateText(text) {
  const document = {
    content: text,
    type: 'PLAIN_TEXT',
  };

  const [result] = await client.moderateText({document});
  console.log('Moderation Results:');
  console.log(result);
}
```

TITLE: Creating Volume Snapshot - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This code illustrates how to create a volume snapshot using the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution API with Node.js. Proper setup of libraries and authentication is required to execute this snippet successfully.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function createVolumeSnapshot() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION',
    volumeSnapshotId: 'YOUR_VOLUME_SNAPSHOT_ID',
    volumeSnapshot: {
      // Volume snapshot configuration here
    },
  };
  const [operation] = await client.createVolumeSnapshot(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log('Volume Snapshot created:', response);
}
createVolumeSnapshot();
```

TITLE: Process Document with Document AI in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code snippet demonstrates how to use the Document AI Node.js client library to process a document and extract text. It initializes the client, reads a file, encodes it, sends a processing request, and then extracts and prints paragraphs from the processed document.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-documentai/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"/**
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment these variables before running the sample.
 */
// const projectId = 'YOUR_PROJECT_ID';
// const location = 'YOUR_PROJECT_LOCATION'; // Format is 'us' or 'eu'
// const processorId = 'YOUR_PROCESSOR_ID'; // Create processor in Cloud Console
// const filePath = '/path/to/local/pdf';

const {DocumentProcessorServiceClient} =
  require('@google-cloud/documentai').v1;

// Instantiates a client
// apiEndpoint regions available: eu-documentai.googleapis.com, us-documentai.googleapis.com (Required if using eu based processor)
// const client = new DocumentProcessorServiceClient({apiEndpoint: 'eu-documentai.googleapis.com'});
const client = new DocumentProcessorServiceClient();

async function quickstart() {
  // The full resource name of the processor, e.g.:
  // projects/project-id/locations/location/processor/processor-id
  // You must create new processors in the Cloud Console first
  const name = `projects/${projectId}/locations/${location}/processors/${processorId}`;

  // Read the file into memory.
  const fs = require('fs').promises;
  const imageFile = await fs.readFile(filePath);

  // Convert the image data to a Buffer and base64 encode it.
  const encodedImage = Buffer.from(imageFile).toString('base64');

  const request = {
    name,
    rawDocument: {
      content: encodedImage,
      mimeType: 'application/pdf',
    },
  };

  // Recognizes text entities in the PDF document
  const [result] = await client.processDocument(request);
  const {document} = result;

  // Get all of the document text as one big string
  const {text} = document;

  // Extract shards from the text field
  const getText = textAnchor => {
    if (!textAnchor.textSegments || textAnchor.textSegments.length === 0) {
      return '';
    }

    // First shard in document doesn't have startIndex property
    const startIndex = textAnchor.textSegments[0].startIndex || 0;
    const endIndex = textAnchor.textSegments[0].endIndex;

    return text.substring(startIndex, endIndex);
  };

  // Read the text recognition output from the processor
  console.log('The document contains the following paragraphs:');
  const [page1] = document.pages;
  const {paragraphs} = page1;

  for (const paragraph of paragraphs) {
    const paragraphText = getText(paragraph.layout.textAnchor);
    console.log(`Paragraph text:\n${paragraphText}`);
  }
}

"
```

TITLE: Updating Guest Policy - Google Cloud OS Config - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet updates an existing guest policy in the OS Config service. You need to provide the necessary guest policy details and use the Google Cloud Node.js client library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-osconfig/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// sample code for updating guest policy
const {OsConfigServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/os-config');
const client = new OsConfigServiceClient();

async function updateGuestPolicy(policyId, policyDetails) {
    const request = {guestPolicy: policyDetails};
    await client.updateGuestPolicy(request);
    console.log(`Updated guest policy: ${policyId}`);
}
updateGuestPolicy('GUEST_POLICY_ID', { /* policy details */ });
```

TITLE: Initializing Key Management Service Client in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Set up a KeyManagementServiceClient to interact with Google Cloud KMS, list key rings in a specific project and location. Requires project and location configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-kms/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {KeyManagementServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/kms');

// Instantiates a client
const client = new KeyManagementServiceClient();

// Build the location name
const locationName = client.locationPath(projectId, locationId);

async function listKeyRings() {
  const [keyRings] = await client.listKeyRings({
    parent: locationName,
  });

  for (const keyRing of keyRings) {
    console.log(keyRing.name);
  }

  return keyRings;
}

return listKeyRings();
```

TITLE: Creating Workflow Template - Google Cloud Dataproc - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a workflow template in Google Cloud Dataproc using the API. It requires authentication with Google Cloud and proper configuration of the Dataproc service client. The function takes parameters for the workflow template configuration and outputs the created template details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-dataproc/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Import required libraries
const {WorkflowTemplateServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/dataproc');

// Create a client
const client = new WorkflowTemplateServiceClient();

async function createWorkflowTemplate() {
  // Define the workflow template
  const template = {
    // ...template properties
  };
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/your-project/regions/global',
    workflowTemplate: template,
  };

  // Create the workflow template
  const [response] = await client.createWorkflowTemplate(request);
  console.log('Created workflow template:', response);
}
```

TITLE: Getting LUN - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to get the details of a Logical Unit Number (LUN) in the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. Ensure necessary permissions are set to execute the code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function getLun() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/luns/YOUR_LUN_ID',
  };
  const response = await client.getLun(request);
  console.log('LUN details:', response);
}
getLun();
```

TITLE: Deleting Workflow Template - Google Cloud Dataproc - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to delete a specific workflow template from Google Cloud Dataproc. The method requires the name of the workflow template to be deleted and expects the operation result upon execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-dataproc/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Import required libraries
const {WorkflowTemplateServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/dataproc');

// Create a client
const client = new WorkflowTemplateServiceClient();

async function deleteWorkflowTemplate(templateName) {
  const request = {
    name: templateName,
  };
  const [operation] = await client.deleteWorkflowTemplate(request);
  console.log('Deleted workflow template:', operation);
}
```

}

TITLE: Setting IAM Policy for Policy Tag in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set an IAM policy for a specified policy tag in Google Cloud's Data Catalog. The google-cloud-datacatalog package is necessary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

async function setIamPolicy() {
  const request = {
    resource: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/policyTags/YOUR_POLICY_TAG_ID',
    policy: {/* your policy details */},
  };
  const [policy] = await client.setIamPolicy(request);
  console.log('Policy set:', policy);
}
setIamPolicy();
```

TITLE: Creating SSH Key - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates creating an SSH key in the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution. The script requires Node.js and the Google Cloud libraries for proper functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function createSshKey() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION',
    sshKeyId: 'YOUR_SSH_KEY_ID',
    key: 'YOUR_SSH_PUBLIC_KEY',
  };
  const [operation] = await client.createSshKey(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log('SSH Key created:', response);
}
createSshKey();
```

TITLE: Applying Deployment with Telco Automation API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This sample demonstrates how to apply a deployment using the Telco Automation API. It requires the Google Cloud Node.js client library to be installed and set up correctly. The script executes the deployment operation and outputs the result based on the deployment's status.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-telcoautomation/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { TelcoAutomationClient } = require('@google-cloud/telcoautomation');

const client = new TelcoAutomationClient();

async function applyDeployment() {
  const request = {/* request parameters */};
  const [operation] = await client.applyDeployment(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log('Deployment Applied:', response);
}

applyDeployment();
```

TITLE: Listing Cloud Assets with Node.js client
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to list assets using the Cloud Asset Inventory API with the Node.js client library. It initializes the client, constructs a request with the project resource and asset types, and then calls the listAssets method to retrieve the assets. The result is then printed to the console using util.inspect for detailed output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-asset/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
/**
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment these variables before running the sample.
 */
// const assetTypes = 'storage.googleapis.com/Bucket,bigquery.googleapis.com/Table';
// const contentType = 'RESOURCE';

const util = require('util');
const {v1} = require('@google-cloud/asset');
const client = new v1.AssetServiceClient();

const projectResource = `projects/${projectId}`;
// TODO(developer): Choose types of assets to list, such as 'storage.googleapis.com/Bucket':
//   const assetTypes = 'storage.googleapis.com/Bucket,bigquery.googleapis.com/Table';
// Or simply use empty string to list all types of assets:
//   const assetTypes = '';
const assetTypesList = assetTypes ? assetTypes.split(',') : [];

async function listAssets() {
  const request = {
    parent: projectResource,
    assetTypes: assetTypesList,
    contentType: contentType,
    // (Optional) Add readTime parameter to list assets at the given time instead of current time:
    //   readTime: { seconds: 1593988758 },
  };

  // Call cloud.assets.v1.ListAssets API.
  const result = await client.listAssets(request);
  // Handle the response.
  console.log(util.inspect(result, {depth: null}));
}
listAssets();

```

TITLE: Using Phishing Protection Client Library
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to initialize the Phishing Protection client and report a phishing URI using the API. The code shows setting up the client, formatting the project path, and making a request to report phishing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-phishingprotection/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {
  PhishingProtectionServiceV1Beta1Client,
} = require('@google-cloud/phishing-protection');
const client = new PhishingProtectionServiceV1Beta1Client();

// the numeric project ID.
const formattedParent = client.projectPath(projectId);
const request = {
  parent: formattedParent,
  uri: uri, // the URI to report to Phishing API.
};

await client.reportPhishing(request);

console.info(`reported ${uri} to Phishing Protection API`);
```

TITLE: Creating a Workflow - Google Cloud Workflows - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a new workflow in Google Cloud Workflows. It requires Node.js, access to Google Cloud Workflows API, and the workflow definition in the request. The key parameters include the workflow name and the definition itself. The output will confirm the creation of the workflow along with its ID.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-workflows-executions/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {WorkflowsClient} = require('@google-cloud/workflows-executions');

async function createWorkflow() {
  const client = new WorkflowsClient();
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION_ID',
    workflow: {
      name: 'YOUR_WORKFLOW_NAME',
      definition: 'YOUR_WORKFLOW_DEFINITION'
    }
  };
  const [response] = await client.createWorkflow(request);
  console.log(`Created workflow: ${response.name}`);
}
createWorkflow();
```

TITLE: Getting IAM Policy for a Policy Tag Manager in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This code retrieves the IAM policy associated with a resource managed by Policy Tag Manager within Google Cloud Data Catalog, using Node.js and the google-cloud-datacatalog library. It uses the `getIamPolicy` method to fetch the IAM policy. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(resource) {
  // [START datacatalog_get_iam_policy]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const resource = 'PROJECT_ID'; // Resource path.

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function getIamPolicy() {
    const [policy] = await policyTagManagerClient.getIamPolicy({
      resource: resource,
    });

    console.log('Got IAM policy for resource: %s', resource);
    console.log(policy);
  }
  getIamPolicy();
  // [END datacatalog_get_iam_policy]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

TITLE: Using Cloud Data Loss Prevention API in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the Cloud Data Loss Prevention API to inspect content for sensitive information. It sets up the client, defines inspection parameters, and processes the results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-privacy-dlp/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Instantiates a client
const dlp = new DLP.DlpServiceClient();

// The string to inspect
const string = 'Robert Frost';

// The project ID to run the API call under
// const projectId = 'my-project';

async function quickStart() {
  // The minimum likelihood required before returning a match
  const minLikelihood = 'LIKELIHOOD_UNSPECIFIED';

  // The maximum number of findings to report (0 = server maximum)
  const maxFindings = 0;

  // The infoTypes of information to match
  const infoTypes = [{name: 'PERSON_NAME'}, {name: 'US_STATE'}];

  // Whether to include the matching string
  const includeQuote = true;

  // Construct item to inspect
  const item = {value: string};

  // Construct request
  const request = {
    parent: `projects/${projectId}/locations/global`,
    inspectConfig: {
      infoTypes: infoTypes,
      minLikelihood: minLikelihood,
      limits: {
        maxFindingsPerRequest: maxFindings,
      },
      includeQuote: includeQuote,
    },
    item: item,
  };

  // Run request
  const [response] = await dlp.inspectContent(request);
  const findings = response.result.findings;
  if (findings.length > 0) {
    console.log('Findings:');
    findings.forEach(finding => {
      if (includeQuote) {
        console.log(`\tQuote: ${finding.quote}`);
      }
      console.log(`\tInfo type: ${finding.infoType.name}`);
      console.log(`\tLikelihood: ${finding.likelihood}`);
    });
  } else {
    console.log('No findings.');
  }
}
quickStart();
```

TITLE: Listing Executions - Google Cloud Workflows - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists all executions for a specified workflow. It requires Node.js and access to Google Cloud Workflows API. The workflow ID is the key parameter needed for the request. The output will include details of all executions associated with the workflow in a JSON format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-workflows-executions/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {ExecutionsClient} = require('@google-cloud/workflows-executions');

async function listExecutions() {
  const client = new ExecutionsClient();
  const workflowId = 'YOUR_WORKFLOW_ID';
  const request = {parent: `projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION_ID/workflows/${workflowId}`};
  const [response] = await client.listExecutions(request);
  console.log(response);
}
listExecutions();
```

TITLE: Getting Taxonomy in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to retrieve a specific taxonomy from Google Cloud's Data Catalog service using the Node.js client. The google-cloud-datacatalog package is required.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

async function getTaxonomy() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/taxonomies/YOUR_TAXONOMY_ID',
  };
  const [taxonomy] = await client.getTaxonomy(request);
  console.log('Taxonomy:', taxonomy);
}
getTaxonomy();
```

DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the Storage Transfer Service client library to create a one-time transfer job between two Google Cloud Storage buckets. It initializes the client, creates a transfer job request, and then runs the transfer job.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-storagetransfer/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Cloud client library
const {
  StorageTransferServiceClient,
} = require('@google-cloud/storage-transfer');

/**
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment the following lines before running the sample.
 */
// Your project id
// const projectId = 'my-project'

// The ID of the GCS bucket to transfer data from
// const gcsSourceBucket = 'my-source-bucket'

// The ID of the GCS bucket to transfer data to
// const gcsSinkBucket = 'my-sink-bucket'

// Creates a client
const client = new StorageTransferServiceClient();

/**
 * Creates a one-time transfer job.
 */
async function quickstart() {
  // Creates a request to transfer from the source bucket to
  // the sink bucket
  const createRequest = {
    transferJob: {
      projectId: projectId,
      transferSpec: {
        gcsDataSource: {bucketName: gcsSourceBucket},
        gcsDataSink: {bucketName: gcsSinkBucket},
      },
      status: 'ENABLED',
    },
  };

  // Runs the request and creates the job
  const [transferJob] = await client.createTransferJob(createRequest);

  const runRequest = {
    jobName: transferJob.name,
    projectId: projectId,
  };
  await client.runTransferJob(runRequest);

  console.log(
    `Created and ran a transfer job from ${gcsSourceBucket} to ${gcsSinkBucket} with name ${transferJob.name}`
  );
}

quickstart();
```

DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to create a client for BeyondCorp API using Node.js, and make an asynchronous call to list client gateways. The Node.js client library '@google-cloud/clientgateways' is required. It uses the ClientGatewaysServiceClient class to make API calls asynchronously, iterating through and printing each response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-beyondcorp-clientgateways/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
/*
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment these variables before running the sample.
 */
/**
 *  Required. Parent value for ListClientGatewaysRequest.
 */

/**
 *  Optional. Requested page size. Server may return fewer items than
 *  requested. If unspecified, server will pick an appropriate default.
 */

/**

 */

/**
 *  Optional. Filtering results.
 */

/**

 */
// const orderBy = 'abc123'

// Imports the Clientgateways library
const {ClientGatewaysServiceClient} =
  require('@google-cloud/clientgateways').v1;

// Instantiates a client
const clientgatewaysClient = new ClientGatewaysServiceClient();

async function callListClientGateways() {
  // Construct request
  const request = {
    parent,
  };

  // Run request
  const iterable =

  }
}

TITLE: Listing Google Analytics Accounts using Node.js Client
DESCRIPTION: Example code demonstrating how to instantiate the Analytics Admin client and list all available accounts. Includes error handling and shows how to optionally configure authentication using a service account JSON file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-analytics-admin/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Analytics Admin API client library
const analyticsAdmin = require('@google-analytics/admin');

async function main() {
  // Instantiates a client using default credentials.
  // TODO(developer): uncomment and use the following line in order to
  //  manually set the path to the service account JSON file instead of
  //  using the value from the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment
  //  variable.
  // const analyticsAdminClient = new analyticsAdmin.AnalyticsAdminServiceClient(
  //     {keyFilename: "your_key_json_file_path"});
  const analyticsAdminClient = new analyticsAdmin.AnalyticsAdminServiceClient();

  // Calls listAccounts() method of the Google Analytics Admin API and prints
  // the response for each account.
  const [accounts] = await analyticsAdminClient.listAccounts();

  console.log('Accounts:');
  accounts.forEach(account => {
    console.log(account);
  });
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});
process.on('unhandledRejection', err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});
```

TITLE: Using Google Cloud Text-to-Speech Client - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the Google Cloud Text-to-Speech client library to synthesize speech from text. It creates a client, constructs a synthesis request, and writes the output audio to a file. Ensure necessary libraries are imported and authentication is set up before running the code.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-texttospeech/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Cloud client library
const textToSpeech = require('@google-cloud/text-to-speech');

// Import other required libraries
const fs = require('fs');
const util = require('util');
// Creates a client
const client = new textToSpeech.TextToSpeechClient();
async function quickStart() {
  // The text to synthesize
  const text = 'hello, world!';

  // Construct the request
  const request = {
    input: {text: text},
    // Select the language and SSML voice gender (optional)
    voice: {languageCode: 'en-US', ssmlGender: 'NEUTRAL'},
    // select the type of audio encoding
    audioConfig: {audioEncoding: 'MP3'},
  };

  // Performs the text-to-speech request
  const [response] = await client.synthesizeSpeech(request);
  // Write the binary audio content to a local file
  const writeFile = util.promisify(fs.writeFile);
  await writeFile('output.mp3', response.audioContent, 'binary');
  console.log('Audio content written to file: output.mp3');
}
quickStart();
```

TITLE: Updating Notebook Instances in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet details how to update the configuration of a notebook instance using the Google Cloud Notebooks Node.js client. Users must provide the instance ID and the new configuration details to update. Successful execution confirms the update.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-notebooks/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Sample code to update a notebook instance
const {NotebookServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/notebooks');

const client = new NotebookServiceClient();

async function updateInstance(instanceId, updateMask) {
    const request = {
        instance: {
            name: `projects/my-project/locations/us-central1-a/instances/${instanceId}`,
            ...updateMask
        },
        updateMask: 'label'
    };
    const [operation] = await client.updateInstance(request);
    await operation.promise();
    console.log(`Instance ${instanceId} updated.`);
}
updateInstance('my-notebook-instance', {labels: {newLabel: 'newValue'}});
```

TITLE: Deleting a Dataset in AutoML with Node.js

SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-automl/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const automl = require('@google-cloud/automl');

// Instantiate client
const client = new automl.v1.AutoMlClient();

async function deleteDataset(projectId, computeRegion, datasetId) {
  const request = {
    name: client.datasetPath(projectId, computeRegion, datasetId),
  };
  const [operation] = await client.deleteDataset(request);
  await operation.promise();
  console.log(`Dataset deleted: ${datasetId}`);
}

deleteDataset('your-project-id', 'us-central1', 'your-dataset-id');
```

}

// Edge_network.initialize_zone.js

const {EdgeNetworkServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/edgenetwork');

}

initializeZone('your-zone-id');

TITLE: Using BigQuery Data Transfer Service Client - Node.js Example
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to initialize the client and list data sources using both iteration and stream methods. Demonstrates pagination handling and async/await pattern.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-bigquery-datatransfer/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const bigqueryDataTransfer = require('@google-cloud/bigquery-data-transfer');
const client = new bigqueryDataTransfer.v1.DataTransferServiceClient();

async function quickstart() {
  const projectId = await client.getProjectId();

  // Iterate over all elements.
  const formattedParent = client.projectPath(projectId, 'us-central1');
  let nextRequest = {parent: formattedParent};
  const options = {autoPaginate: false};
  console.log('Data sources:');
  do {
    // Fetch the next page.
    const responses = await client.listDataSources(nextRequest, options);
    // The actual resources in a response.
    const resources = responses[0];
    // The next request if the response shows that there are more responses.
    nextRequest = responses[1];
    // The actual response object, if necessary.
    // const rawResponse = responses[2];
    resources.forEach(resource => {
      console.log(`  ${resource.name}`);
    });
  } while (nextRequest);

  console.log('\n\n');
  console.log('Sources via stream:');

  client
    .listDataSourcesStream({parent: formattedParent})
    .on('data', element => {
      console.log(`  ${element.name}`);
    });
}
quickstart();
```

// specified in GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable.

        endDate: 'today',
      },
    ],
    dimensions: [

      },
    ],
  });

  console.log('Report result:');

}

runReport();

TITLE: Creating a Taxonomy in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates creating a new Taxonomy in Google Cloud Data Catalog using the google-cloud-datacatalog library in Node.js.  It leverages the `createTaxonomy` method to create a taxonomy within a specified location. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(parent, taxonomy) {
  // [START datacatalog_create_taxonomy]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const parent = 'projects/{project}/locations/{location}';
  // const taxonomy = {};

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function createTaxonomy() {
    const [taxonomy] = await policyTagManagerClient.createTaxonomy({
      parent: parent,
      taxonomy: taxonomy,
    });
    console.log(`Taxonomy : ${taxonomy.name}`);
  }
  createTaxonomy();
  // [END datacatalog_create_taxonomy]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```

TITLE: Updating a Policy Tag in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates updating a Policy Tag within Google Cloud Data Catalog using the google-cloud-datacatalog library with Node.js. The `updatePolicyTag` method is called with the desired changes to the policy tag. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(policyTag) {
  // [START datacatalog_update_policy_tag]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const policyTag = {};

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function updatePolicyTag() {
    const [response] = await policyTagManagerClient.updatePolicyTag({
      policyTag: policyTag,
    });
    console.log(`Policy Tag updated: ${response.name}`);
  }
  updatePolicyTag();
  // [END datacatalog_update_policy_tag]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```

TITLE: Using Cloud Life Sciences Client in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: The code demonstrates how to use the Google Cloud Life Sciences client library in a Node.js application to check the progress of a pipeline run. It requires creating a WorkflowsServiceV2BetaClient instance and calling its method with project-specific identifiers. Node.js and the client library should be installed beforehand.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-lifesciences/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Cloud client library

const {WorkflowsServiceV2BetaClient} = require('@google-cloud/life-sciences');

// const pipeline = 'name-of-pipeline', i.e., 1234
// const projectId = your-project-id
// const location = your-pipeline-location

// Creates a client
const client = new WorkflowsServiceV2BetaClient();

async function checkPipelineProgress() {
  const status = await client.checkRunPipelineProgress(
    `projects/${projectId}/locations/${location}/operations/${pipeline}`
  );
  console.info(status);
}
checkPipelineProgress();

```

TITLE: Stopping Notebook Instances in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to stop a running notebook instance using the Google Cloud Notebooks Node.js client. It requires authentication with Google Cloud and the instance ID as a key parameter. The output confirms the successful stop of the instance.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-notebooks/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Sample code to stop a notebook instance
const {NotebookServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/notebooks');

const client = new NotebookServiceClient();

async function stopInstance(instanceId) {
    const request = {
        name: `projects/my-project/locations/us-central1-a/instances/${instanceId}`,
    };
    const [operation] = await client.stopInstance(request);
    await operation.promise();
    console.log(`Instance ${instanceId} stopped.`);
}
stopInstance('my-notebook-instance');
```

TITLE: Detaching LUN - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to detach a Logical Unit Number (LUN) in the Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. Ensure you have the necessary permissions for executing this operation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function detachLun() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/luns/YOUR_LUN_ID',
  };
  const [operation] = await client.detachLun(request);
  await operation.promise();
  console.log('LUN detached.');
}
detachLun();
```

TITLE: Getting a Dataset in AutoML with Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides the functionality to retrieve information about a specific dataset in AutoML using Node.js. The dataset ID must be specified, and the corresponding dataset details are returned.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-automl/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const automl = require('@google-cloud/automl');

// Instantiate client
const client = new automl.v1.AutoMlClient();

async function getDataset(projectId, computeRegion, datasetId) {
  const request = {
    name: client.datasetPath(projectId, computeRegion, datasetId),
  };
  const [response] = await client.getDataset(request);
  console.log(`Dataset: ${JSON.stringify(response)}`);
}

getDataset('your-project-id', 'us-central1', 'your-dataset-id');
```

  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/sshKeys/YOUR_SSH_KEY_ID',

  console.log('SSH Key deleted.');
}

TITLE: Listing Kubernetes Clusters with Node.js Client
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to initialize the Cluster Manager client and list clusters in a specified zone. This code demonstrates basic usage of the Container Engine API including project ID retrieval and cluster listing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-container/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
async function main() {
  const container = require('@google-cloud/container');

  // Create the Cluster Manager Client
  const client = new container.v1.ClusterManagerClient();

  async function quickstart() {
    const zone = 'us-central1-a';
    const projectId = await client.getProjectId();
    const request = {
      projectId: projectId,
      zone: zone,
    };

    const [response] = await client.listClusters(request);
    console.log('Clusters: ', response);
  }
  quickstart();
}

main().catch(console.error);
```

TITLE: Creating Tag in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a tag in Google Cloud's Data Catalog service using the Node.js client library. It requires the google-cloud-datacatalog package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {DataCatalogClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new DataCatalogClient();

async function createTag() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/entryGroups/YOUR_ENTRY_GROUP_ID/entries/YOUR_ENTRY_ID',
    tag: {
      displayName: 'YOUR_TAG_NAME',
      fields: {/* your tag fields */},
    },
  };
  const [response] = await client.createTag(request);
  console.log('Tag created:', response);
}
createTag();
```

/**

const {TranscoderServiceClient} =
  require('@google-cloud/video-transcoder').v1;
const client = new TranscoderServiceClient();
async function listJobs() {
  const [jobs] = await client.listJobs({

}

TITLE: Breaking Change: Upgrade to Node 18
DESCRIPTION: This entry signifies a major breaking change where the minimum supported Node.js version was upgraded to Node 18. This change may require users to update their Node.js runtime to be compatible with the newer library version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-devtools-cloudprofiler/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Text
CODE:
```

TITLE: Updating Slate in Google Cloud Video Stitcher - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet updates the slate for the Google Cloud Video Stitcher service. It allows users to modify the visual placeholder shown during buffering or downtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-video-stitcher/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {VideoStitcherServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/video-stitcher');

const client = new VideoStitcherServiceClient();
async function updateSlate(slateId, newSlate) {
  const request = { slateId, ...newSlate };
  const response = await client.updateSlate(request);
  console.log('Updated Slate:', response);
}
updateSlate('your-slate-id', { /* new slate object */ });
```

TITLE: Deleting a Version in Google App Engine - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet handles the deletion of a specific version of a service in Google App Engine. It calls the delete version method from the API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-appengine/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// Source code for deleting a version
// File: versions.delete_version.js

const {google} = require('googleapis');
const appengine = google.appengine('v1');

async function deleteVersion(serviceName, versionId) {
  const res = await appengine.versions.delete({
    name: `apps/your-app-id/services/${serviceName}/versions/${versionId}`
  });
  console.log(res.data);
}

deleteVersion('your-service-name', 'your-version-id');
```

TITLE: Migrating from Old to New Translate Module Import Pattern in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Example showing the breaking change in v2.0.0 where direct module instantiation was replaced with class-based instantiation. This change was made to provide consistency with ES modules.

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```

const translate = require('@google-cloud/translate')({
  keyFilename: '...'
});
```

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// New code
const {Translate} = require('@google-cloud/translate');
const translate = new Translate({
  keyFilename: '...'
});
```

  const [response] = await client.getDataAttributeBinding(request);
  console.log(response);
}
getDataAttributeBinding();
```

TITLE: Listing Delivery Pipelines with Google Cloud Deploy Node.js Client
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to use the Google Cloud Deploy client library to list delivery pipelines. It includes importing the library, instantiating a client, constructing a request, and iterating through the results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-deploy/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
/**
 * TODO(developer): Uncomment these variables before running the sample.
 */
/**
 *  Required. The parent, which owns this collection of pipelines. Format must be
 *  projects/{project_id}/locations/{location_name}.
 */
// const parent = 'abc123'
/**
 *  The maximum number of pipelines to return. The service may return
 *  fewer than this value. If unspecified, at most 50 pipelines will
 *  be returned. The maximum value is 1000; values above 1000 will be set
 *  to 1000.
 */
// const pageSize = 1234
/**
 *  A page token, received from a previous `ListDeliveryPipelines` call.
 *  Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.
 *  When paginating, all other provided parameters match
 *  the call that provided the page token.
 */
// const pageToken = 'abc123'
/**
 *  Filter builds to be returned. See https://google.aip.dev/160 for more
 *  details.
 */
// const filter = 'abc123'
/**
 *  Field to sort by. See https://google.aip.dev/132#ordering for more details.
 */
// const orderBy = 'abc123'

// Imports the Deploy library
const {CloudDeployClient} = require('@google-cloud/deploy').v1;

// Instantiates a client
const deployClient = new CloudDeployClient();

async function listDeliveryPipelines() {
  // Construct request
  const request = {
    parent,
  };

  // Run request
  const iterable = await deployClient.listDeliveryPipelinesAsync(request);
  for await (const response of iterable) {
    console.log(response);
  }
}

listDeliveryPipelines();
```

TITLE: Resuming Patch Deployment - Google Cloud OS Config - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet resumes a previously paused patch deployment using the OS Config service in Google Cloud. It uses the Node.js client library to facilitate the action.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-osconfig/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
// sample code for resuming patch deployment
const {OsConfigServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/os-config');
const client = new OsConfigServiceClient();

async function resumePatchDeployment(deploymentId) {
    const request = {name: deploymentId};
    await client.resumePatchDeployment(request);
    console.log(`Resumed patch deployment: ${deploymentId}`);
}
resumePatchDeployment('PATCH_DEPLOYMENT_ID');
```

TITLE: Listing Taxonomies in Google Cloud Datacatalog - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides functionality to list all taxonomies in Google Cloud's Data Catalog service. It requires the google-cloud-datacatalog package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog');
const client = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

async function listTaxonomies() {
  const request = {
    parent: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT_ID/locations/YOUR_LOCATION',
  };
  const [response] = await client.listTaxonomies(request);
  response.forEach(taxonomy => console.log(taxonomy.displayName));
}
listTaxonomies();
```

TITLE: Creating Connection Profile in Google Cloud Datastream - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: Creates a new connection profile in Google Cloud Datastream. This snippet necessitates the Google Cloud Datastream client library and suitable permissions for creating connection profiles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datastream/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {DatastreamClient} = require('@google-cloud/datastream');

const client = new DatastreamClient();

async function createConnectionProfile() {
  const request = {
    // Connection profile parameters
  };

  const [operation] = await client.createConnectionProfile(request);
  const [response] = await operation.promise();
  console.log('Connection profile created:', response);

TITLE: Loading Dialogflow CX Version - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet loads a specific version of a Dialogflow CX agent. It allows you to retrieve the details of a given version by calling the appropriate API endpoint. Dependencies include the Dialogflow CX library. It requires the version ID to be passed as a parameter and returns the version details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-dialogflow-cx/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_148

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {VersionsClient} = require('@google-cloud/dialogflow-cx');
const client = new VersionsClient();

async function loadVersion(versionId) {
  const request = {
    name: `projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/agents/YOUR_AGENT/versions/${versionId}`
  };
  const response = await client.getVersion(request);
  console.log('Version details:', response);
}

loadVersion('VERSION_ID');
```

TITLE: Updating Space Read State in Google Chat - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to update the read state of a space in Google Chat. It requires Node.js and the Google Chat API. The expected input is the space ID and the read state details. The output is the updated space information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-chat/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
```javascript
// Code to update space read state
const { ChatServiceClient } = require('@google-cloud/chat');
const client = new ChatServiceClient();
async function updateSpaceReadState(spaceId, readState) {
  const request = {
    spaceId: spaceId,
    readState: readState
  };
  const [response] = await client.updateSpaceReadState(request);
  console.log(`Updated Space: ${response.name}`);
}
```
```

TITLE: Creating a Policy Tag in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a Policy Tag in Google Cloud Data Catalog, utilizing the google-cloud-datacatalog library within a Node.js environment. It uses the `createPolicyTag` method to instantiate the new policy tag. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(parent, policyTag) {
  // [START datacatalog_create_policy_tag]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const parent = 'projects/{project}/locations/{location}/taxonomies/{taxonomy}';  // Taxonomy name.
  // const policyTag = {};

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function createPolicyTag() {
    const [policyTag] = await policyTagManagerClient.createPolicyTag({
      parent: parent,
      policyTag: policyTag,
    });
    console.log(`Policy Tag : ${policyTag.name}`);
  }
  createPolicyTag();
  // [END datacatalog_create_policy_tag]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```

TITLE: Using IAM Policy Troubleshooter Client Library
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to initialize the IAM Checker client and troubleshoot an IAM policy. The code creates a client instance and makes a request to analyze access permissions for a given principal, resource, and permission combination.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-policytroubleshooter/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Imports the Google Cloud client library
const {IamCheckerClient} = require('@google-cloud/policy-troubleshooter');

// TODO(developer): replace with your prefered project ID.
// const projectId = 'my-project'

// Creates a client
const client = new IamCheckerClient();

async function troubelshootPolicy() {
  const policy = await client.troubleshootIamPolicy({
    accessTuple: {
      principal,
      fullResourceName,
      permission,
    },
  });
  console.log(policy);
}

troubelshootPolicy();
```

TITLE: Initializing Grafeas Client and Listing Occurrences in Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize the Grafeas client, set up a request to list occurrences, and execute the request. It uses gRPC for communication and overrides default service settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/grafeas/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// const projectId = 'my-project';

// instantiate the client.
const grpc = require('@grpc/grpc-js');
const {GrafeasClient} = require('@google-cloud/grafeas');
const client = new GrafeasClient({
  sslCreds: grpc.credentials.createInsecure(), // or any other credentials object.
  servicePath: '0.0.0.0', // overriding the service path.
  port: 8080, // overriding the port.
});

// populate the request.
const formattedName = client.projectPath(projectId);
const request = {
  parent: formattedName,
};

// fetch the list of occurrences.
const [resp] = await client.listOccurrences(request);
console.info(resp);
```

TITLE: Getting Data Exchange - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to retrieve details of a specific data exchange using the Analytics Hub API in Node.js. Make sure to authenticate to access the data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-bigquery-analyticshub/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Sample code to get a data exchange
// Requires installation of the Google Cloud client library

const {AnalyticsHubServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/bigquery-analyticshub');
const client = new AnalyticsHubServiceClient();

async function getDataExchange() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/your-project-id/dataExchanges/your-data-exchange-id',
  };
  const [response] = await client.getDataExchange(request);
  console.log('Data Exchange retrieved:', response);
}

getDataExchange();
```

TITLE: Getting Subscription - Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to retrieve details of a specific subscription using the Analytics Hub API in Node.js. Ensure correct authentication before execution.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-bigquery-analyticshub/samples/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Sample code to get a subscription
// Requires installation of the Google Cloud client library

const {AnalyticsHubServiceClient} = require('@google-cloud/bigquery-analyticshub');
const client = new AnalyticsHubServiceClient();

async function getSubscription() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/your-project-id/subscriptions/your-subscription-id',
  };
  const [response] = await client.getSubscription(request);
  console.log('Subscription retrieved:', response);
}

getSubscription();
```

TITLE: Testing IAM Permissions for Policy Tag Manager in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet checks IAM permissions on a resource managed by the Policy Tag Manager in Google Cloud Data Catalog, using the google-cloud-datacatalog library and Node.js. It utilizes the `testIamPermissions` method to determine if the caller has the specified permissions. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(resource, permissions) {
  // [START datacatalog_test_iam_permissions]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const resource = 'PROJECT_ID'; // Resource path.
  // const permissions = ['datacatalog.entries.get'];

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function testIamPermissions() {
    const [policy] = await policyTagManagerClient.testIamPermissions({
      resource: resource,
      permissions: permissions,
    });

    console.log('Tested permissions for resource: %s', resource);
    console.log(policy);
  }
  testIamPermissions();
  // [END datacatalog_test_iam_permissions]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```

TITLE: Deleting Volume Snapshot - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides functionality to delete a volume snapshot from the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. Necessary permissions should be granted to perform this operation smoothly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function deleteVolumeSnapshot() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/volumeSnapshots/YOUR_VOLUME_SNAPSHOT_ID',
  };
  const [operation] = await client.deleteVolumeSnapshot(request);
  await operation.promise();
  console.log('Volume Snapshot deleted.');
}
deleteVolumeSnapshot();
```

### Features

* [Many APIs] await/catch promises, and update listOperationsAsync return type ([#6182](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/issues/6182)) ([c41ff07](https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/commit/c41ff0729b65a1207978b4029d6369cc0552e0bf))

### Features

### Miscellaneous Chores

/**
 *  Required. The parent value for the Autonomous Database in the following
 *  format: projects/{project}/locations/{location}.
 */
// const parent = 'abc123'
/**
 *  Optional. The maximum number of items to return.
 *  If unspecified, at most 50 Autonomous Database will be returned.

 */
// const pageSize = 1234
/**

 */

/**
 *  Optional. An expression for filtering the results of the request.
 */

/**
 *  Optional. An expression for ordering the results of the request.
 */

// Imports the Oracledatabase library

// Instantiates a client

async function callListAutonomousDatabases() {
  // Construct request
  const request = {
    parent,
  };

  // Run request
  const iterable = oracledatabaseClient.listAutonomousDatabasesAsync(request);

  }
}

callListAutonomousDatabases();

CODE:

async function callListCases() {
  const request = {
    parent,
    filter,
    pageSize,
    pageToken
  };

  const iterable = await supportClient.listCasesAsync(request);
  for await (const response of iterable) {
    console.log(response);
  }
}

callListCases();
```

TITLE: Creating Cluster - JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create a cluster using the Cluster Manager API. It requires the Google Cloud Node.js client library and proper configuration of request parameters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-container/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const {ClusterManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/container');
const client = new ClusterManagerClient();

async function createCluster(clusterParams) {
  const response = await client.createCluster(clusterParams);
  console.log(`Cluster created: ${response}`);
}

```

TITLE: Disabling Interactive Serial Console - Google Cloud Node.js
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to disable the interactive serial console for an instance in the Google Cloud Bare Metal Solution using Node.js. Proper configurations and permissions are required to run this code successfully.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-baremetalsolution/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
const { BareMetalSolutionClient } = require('@google-cloud/baremetalsolution');

const client = new BareMetalSolutionClient();
async function disableInteractiveSerialConsole() {
  const request = {
    name: 'projects/YOUR_PROJECT/locations/YOUR_LOCATION/instances/YOUR_INSTANCE_ID',
  };
  const [operation] = await client.disableInteractiveSerialConsole(request);
  await operation.promise();
  console.log('Interactive Serial Console disabled.');
}
disableInteractiveSerialConsole();
```

TITLE: Setting IAM Policy for Policy Tag Manager in Data Catalog (v1beta1) using Javascript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates setting the IAM policy for a resource handled by the Policy Tag Manager in Google Cloud Data Catalog, utilizing the google-cloud-datacatalog library and Node.js. It uses the `setIamPolicy` method to apply the specified policy. Requires the google-cloud-datacatalog dependency.
SOURCE: https://github.com/googleapis/google-cloud-node/blob/main/packages/google-cloud-datacatalog/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
"use strict";

async function main(resource, policy) {
  // [START datacatalog_set_iam_policy]
  // Imports the Google Cloud client library
  const {PolicyTagManagerClient} = require('@google-cloud/datacatalog').v1beta1;

  // TODO(developer): replace with your values
  // const resource = 'PROJECT_ID'; // Resource path.
  // const policy = {};

  // Instantiates a client
  const policyTagManagerClient = new PolicyTagManagerClient();

  async function setIamPolicy() {
    const [response] = await policyTagManagerClient.setIamPolicy({
      resource: resource,
      policy: policy,
    });

    console.log('Set IAM policy for resource: %s', resource);
    console.log(response);
  }
  setIamPolicy();
  // [END datacatalog_set_iam_policy]
}

main(...process.argv.slice(2)).catch(err => {
  console.error(err.message);
  process.exitCode = 1;
});

```
